page.title: 01Our Domesday Block .
page.content: The area forms a N-S valley through which flows the{R.Arrow.}The older buildings, some of the sites of which date back to Domesday, can be found along the{R.Arrow}on{Ipsley Hill}or along {The Ridgeway.} Until the 1960's much of the area was farmland then Redditch was made a{New} Town. The area was developed from a {master plan}with{separate residential, {industrial and recreational areas {linked by a graded road network.}Many roads and estates take their name from the original farms in the area, such as Woodrow Farm. In 1985{Redditch Borough Council}took over control of land and buildings owned by the{Redditch New Town {Development Corporation.} Many older residents regret the changes but newcomers generally think well of the New Town.
